Program name: Bachelor of Arts in Literature
Requirements:
General application requirements vary by level. 

For undergraduate first-year applicants, the required documents are: a completed Common Application or Clarkson Application, official high school transcript(s), and one letter of recommendation from a school counselor or teacher. Clarkson is test-optional for most undergraduate programs, so SAT/ACT scores are not required for admission for most applicants.

For graduate applicants, the required items are: an online application form, statement of purpose, resume or curriculum vitae (CV), letters of recommendation, and official transcripts. Official test scores (like GRE/GMAT) may be required depending on the specific program.

Program name: Bachelor of Arts in Social Science Research Methods
Requirements: To apply as a first-year student, you will need to submit either the Common Application or the Clarkson Application. Required documents include your official high school transcript and one letter of recommendation. A personal essay is also required as part of the application. Clarkson has a test-optional admissions policy, so submitting standardized test scores (SAT or ACT) is optional.
